an3.90:4.3: The training in the higher ethics, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.
an3.90:5.1: And what is the training in the higher ethics?
an3.90:5.2: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, restrained in the code of conduct, and has appropriate behavior and means of collecting alms. Seeing danger in the slightest flaw, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
an3.90:5.4: This is called the training in the higher ethics.
an3.90:6.1: And what is the training in the higher mind?
an3.90:6.2: It’s when a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption … second absorption … third absorption …
an3.90:6.4: This is called the training in the higher mind.
an3.90:7.1: And what is the training in the higher wisdom?
an3.90:7.2: It’s when a mendicant realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.
an3.90:7.3: This is called the training in the higher wisdom.
an3.90:8.2: and the higher wisdom should be practiced
an3.90:8.3: by those energetic, strong, and resolute,
an3.90:8.4: practicing absorption, mindful, with guarded senses.
an3.90:10.1: As by day, so by night;
an3.90:10.2: as by night, so by day.
an3.90:11.1: they call them a ‘trainee on the path’,
an3.90:11.2: and their conduct is well purified.
an3.90:11.3: But a sage who has gone to the end of the path
an3.90:11.4: they call a ‘Buddha’ in the world.
an3.90:12.2: freed by the ending of craving,
an3.90:12.4: is like a lamp going out.”
